newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Ossia in 50 million shares IPO at S$0.61 per share.
newsitem.headline: Ossia in 50 million shares IPO at S$0.61 per share.

text.p: Sporting goods and apparel dealer Ossia International Ltd said on Monday it would offer 50 million shares in an Initial Public Offer (IPO) at Singapore $0.61 per share.

Ossia said it would raise net proceeds of about S$16.3 million to finance the building of its regional headquarters cum distribution centre, to acquire stock, plants and machinery for a subsidiary in Taiwan, and for expansion.
The shares are offered at a forecast price-earnings ratio for the financial year ending December 31, 1996 of 13.6 times.
The offer of 50 million shares represents about 25 percent of the company's share capital.
The offer will close on November 18 and shares will start trading on a when-issued basis on November 20.
For the six months ended June 30, Ossia said it recorded a net profit of S$3.2 million on a turnover of S$48.2 million.
